DOC.detailed_description: This prospective cohort research study conduct Mike O'Callaghan Federal Medical Center ( MOFMC ) , Department Family Medicine Residency Obstetrics Clinics . Subjects pregnant female active duty DoD beneficiaries 18 year older recruit MOFMC , Department Family Medicine Residency Clinic , Obstetrics Orientation Class Nellis AFB . At screen , Research Assistant discuss study , answer question , obtains Informed Consent , schedule appointment routine OB care . The research design include screen visit obtain write consent two ( 2 ) additional laboratory blood test obtain standard care prenatal screen test first second trimester pregnancy . Each laboratory blood test do via 1 venipuncture 5-10 ml ( 1-2 teaspoon ) blood . The OB nurse order labs upon completion Obstetrics Orientation Class . Screening Visit : Initial Standard Care Obstetrics Appointment - Obtain subject sign Informed Consent document HIPAA Authorization - Demographic data : age , race , weight , height , estimate week gestation - Review past medical history First Trimester Prenatal Visit ( < 13 week ) Screen Testing - Subjects routine prenatal lab draw include HbA1C blood test standard care - Subjects fast ( 10 hour ) glucose blood test order along lab ( research drive ) Second Trimester Prenatal Visit ( 24-28 week ) - Subjects routine prenatal lab draw include 2 hr glucose tolerance test ( 2 hr OGTT ) standard care - Subjects HbA1C blood test order along lab ( research drive ) Delivery Neonatal Data Collection -Select data regard delivery neonatal health track . All data already routinely collect standard care find patient record . This require interaction patient neonate
